summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from November 24, 2020, discussing a media inquiry about Ghislaine Maxwell being placed in quarantine due to COVID-19. The email provides a brief update on the Maxwell investigation, stating that victim/witness interviews are ongoing and that Maxwell's attorneys will soon propose a bail package, which is anticipated to involve significant litigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case; mentioned as being placed in quarantine at the Metropolitan Detention Center after a jail staffer tested positive for COVID-19, though she tested negative.

persons.name: Burnson
persons.context: Co-author of the Bloomberg article referenced in the email about Maxwell's quarantine.

persons.name: Hurtado
persons.context: Co-author of the Bloomberg article referenced in the email about Maxwell's quarantine.

persons.name: NY MAC Penza
persons.context: Advised that the media inquiry about Maxwell's quarantine was likely a separate matter from the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Maxwell Placed in Quarantine
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was placed in quarantine at the Metropolitan Detention Center in New York after a jail staff member tested positive for COVID-19. A rapid test found Maxwell to be free of the virus.

events.title: Internal FBI Case Update
events.description: The FBI New York Field Office provides an update on the Maxwell investigation, stating the team has been working to meet discovery obligations and that victim/witness interviews continue. They anticipate Maxwell's attorneys will propose a bail package soon, leading to significant litigation.

locations: US Virgin Islands (mentioned as conducting a separate investigation)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was placed in a 14-day quarantine at the Metropolitan Detention Center in November 2020 after a jail staffer tested positive for COVID-19, though she tested negative.
The FBI update states that victim and witness interviews in the Maxwell case were ongoing as of late November 2020.
The FBI anticipated that Maxwell's attorneys would soon propose a bail package, which was expected to generate significant litigation.
The US Virgin Islands was noted as conducting a separate investigation, distinct from the FBI's case against Maxwell.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination regarding media inquiries and case updates related to high-profile defendants.
